SENT.plain: A case of cerebral air embolism from a rather unusual cause is reported; an esophago-cardiac fistula permitted food particles and air to enter the systemic arterial circulation
Massive embolization caused the patient to become deeply comatose rather suddenly
The computed tomogram (CT) revealed massive cerebral edema with the contradictory finding of wide superficial subarachnoid spaces
These subarachnoid spaces on further evaluation proved to be air in the cerebral vessels
